metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（混合林站物候相机观测数据集-2018）
metadata.description:
The dataset contains phenological camera observation data collected at the Arou Superstation in the midstream of the Heihe integrated observatory network from June 13 to November 16, 2018. The instrument was developed with data processed by Beijing Normal University. The phenomenon camera integrates data acquisition and data transmission functions. The camera captures high-quality data with a resolution of 1280×720 by looking-downward. The calculation of the greenness index and phenology are following 3 steps: (1) calculate the relative greenness index (GCC, Green Chromatic Coordinate, calculated by GCC=G/(R+G+B)) according to the region of interest, (2) perform gap-filling for the invalid values, filtering and smoothing, and (3) determine the key phenological parameters according to the growth curve fitting (such as the growth season start date, Peak, growth season end, etc.) There are also 3 steps for coverage data processing: (1) select images with less intense illumination, (2) divide the image into vegetation and soil, and (3) calculate the proportion of vegetation pixels in each image in the calculation area. After the time series data is extracted, the original coverage data is smoothed and filtered according to the time window specified by the user, and the filtered result is the final time series coverage. This data set includes relative greenness index (Gcc).
Please refer to Liu et al. (2018) for sites information in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含2018年5月16日至11月6日黑河流域地表过程综合观测网下游混合林站的物候相机观测数据，该仪器由北京师范大学自主研发并进行处理。物候相机集成数据获取与数据传输功能。该物候相机采用垂直向下的方式采集数据，拍摄数据分辨率为1280*720，可指定拍摄时间频率。对于绿度指数物候期计算，需要根据感兴趣区域计算相对绿度指数（GCC, Green Chromatic Coordinate公式为GCC=G/(R+G+B), R、G、B为图像红、绿、蓝三通道像元值），然后进行无效值填充和滤波平滑，最后根据生长曲线拟合确定关键物候期参数，如生长季起始日、顶峰、生长季结束日等；对于覆盖度，首先进行数据预处理，选择光照不太强的图像，然后将图像分割为植被和土壤，计算每张图像的植被像素占计算区域内的比例作为该图像对应的覆盖度，在时间序列数据提取完成以后，再按用户指定的时间窗口对原始覆盖度数据进行平滑滤波，滤波后的得结果为最终的时间序列覆盖度。本数据集包括相对绿度指数（Gcc）。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是其经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，先前的研究发现，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域是碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展具有重要意义。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据是通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取的。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向的梯度；以及气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面）是通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期观测的，同时也包括地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Can the eddy covariance system be used to collect data on water vapor and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Verification.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统可以用于收集绿洲-沙漠系统中的水蒸气和碳通量数据吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Are hydrometeorological data, including soil temperature and moisture profiles, collected from automatic weather stations in the studied region?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在研究区域内，是否从自动气象站收集水文气象数据，包括土壤温度和湿度剖面？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which approach is more effective for quantifying carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, eddy covariance systems or scintillometers?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，使用涡度协方差系统还是闪烁仪来量化碳交换，哪种方法更有效？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Do observations in arid and semiarid inland river basins primarily face challenges related to ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, or land desertification?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域的观察主要面临与生态环境退化相关的挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化或土地沙漠化。
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: drying up of rivers and lakes

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据的方法有哪些？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: eddy covariance system, scintillometer, automatic weather stations
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 可以在哪里获取与绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测相关的数据？
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 国家青藏高原数据中心

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in maintaining ecological stability in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，维持内陆河流流域生态稳定面临哪些挑战？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: drying up of rivers and lakes

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to capture energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数据收集方法的例子，用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换？
Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method used to capture energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems involves using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer to acquire half-hourly turbulent flux data, supplemented with hydrometeorological observations from automatic weather stations.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种用于捕捉绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集方法涉及使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪来获取半小时的湍流通量数据，并辅以自动气象站的水文气象观测。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting ecological data in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域收集生态数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge faced when collecting ecological data in inland river basins within arid and semiarid areas includes the ecological environment degradation such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent occurrence of dust storms.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域收集生态数据时面临的一个挑战包括生态环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁发生的沙尘暴。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of a dataset that includes long-term observations of oasis–desert systems?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠系统长期观测的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: A dataset that includes long-term observations of oasis–desert systems consists of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological data and vegetation and soil parameters, collected from a network of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations in the middle and lower reaches of the Heihe River Basin since 2012.
Example.AnswerCn: 一个包含绿洲-沙漠系统长期观测的数据集，包括能量、水蒸气和碳通量，以及水文气象数据和植被与土壤参数，这些数据自2012年以来从黑河流域中下游的11个陆面通量和气象站网络收集而来。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the key features of data collection methods used for monitoring phenological changes in mixed forest stands?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于监测混交林地物候变化的数据收集方法的关键特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: phenology cameras, vertical downward data acquisition, resolution of 1280x720, configurable capture frequency, relative greenness index (GCC), RGB pixel values, curve fitting of growth data
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 物候相机，垂直向下数据采集，分辨率为1280x720，可配置的捕获频率，相对绿色指数（GCC），RGB像素值，生长数据的曲线拟合。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What characteristics define the data processing techniques employed for calculating vegetation cover from time-series images?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 定义用于从时间序列图像计算植被覆盖的数据显示处理技术的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: pre-processing images, moderate lighting, segmenting images into vegetation and soil, calculating proportion of vegetation pixels, smoothing filters, user-defined time window
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 图像预处理，中等光照，将图像分割为植被和土壤，计算植被像素的比例，平滑滤波器，用户定义的时间窗口。

Quantification.QuestionEn: What is the resolution of images collected by phenology cameras in a dataset related to ecological observations?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 与生态观察相关的数据集中，表型相机收集的图像分辨率是多少？

Quantification.QuestionEn: Over what time span is the suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems available?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集可用的时间跨度是多少？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the term 'oasis–desert ecosystem interactions' signify in the context of ecological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: “绿洲–沙漠生态系统相互作用”在生态研究中指的是绿洲与周围沙漠环境之间的相互影响和关系。
Definition.AnswerEn: Oasis–desert ecosystem interactions refer to the exchange of energy, water vapor, and carbon between oasis and desert systems. Understanding these interactions is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development in arid and semi-arid regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠生态系统相互作用是指绿洲与沙漠系统之间能量、水蒸气和碳的交换。理解这些相互作用对于维持生态稳定和支持干旱及半干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: How is 'data processing and quality control' defined in the context of collecting ecological datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在收集生态数据集的背景下，“数据处理和质量控制”是如何定义的？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control involve steps such as data collection, processing, archiving, and sharing. This includes ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data collected from various sources like eddy covariance systems, automatic weather stations, and other auxiliary data on vegetation and soil parameters.
Definition.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制涉及数据收集、处理、归档和共享等步骤。这包括确保从各种来源（如涡度协方差系统、自动气象站以及其他关于植被和土壤参数的辅助数据）收集的数据的准确性和可靠性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the challenges of data collection in inland river basins of arid regions compare to those encountered when monitoring phenological changes in mixed forest stations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 内陆河流流域干旱地区的数据收集挑战与监测混合森林站点的物候变化时遇到的挑战相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face challenges such as ecological degradation, drying water bodies, and land desertification, which can complicate data collection and necessitate long-term observations. Phenological monitoring in mixed forest stations may encounter issues related to data resolution and the need for specific light conditions for accurate image capture. Both settings require careful data processing and quality control, but the environmental challenges and required data adjustments differ.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临生态退化、水体干涸和土地沙漠化等挑战，这可能会使数据收集变得复杂，并需要长期观察。在混合森林站的物候监测中，可能会遇到与数据分辨率相关的问题，以及为了准确捕捉图像所需的特定光照条件。这两种环境都需要仔细的数据处理和质量控制，但环境挑战和所需的数据调整有所不同。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What insights can be drawn from the use of phenological cameras about seasonal vegetation dynamics and their impact on the oasis-desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用物候相机可以获得关于季节性植被动态及其对绿洲-沙漠生态系统影响的洞察。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of phenological cameras provides detailed data on vegetation cover and relative greenness index, which can be used to determine key phenological phases such as the start, peak, and end of the growing season. These insights are crucial for understanding the dynamics of vegetation in oasis-desert ecosystems, which play a significant role in maintaining ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic activities in arid and semiarid regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用物候相机可以提供关于植被覆盖和相对绿度指数的详细数据，这些数据可以用来确定关键的物候阶段，如生长季节的开始、峰值和结束。这些见解对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中植被的动态至关重要，这些生态系统在维持生态稳定性和支持干旱及半干旱地区的社会经济活动中发挥着重要作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations improve the accuracy and reliability of data on energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 涡度协方差系统与自动气象站的结合如何提高绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳通量数据的准确性和可靠性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of eddy covariance systems, which provide high-resolution data on turbulent fluxes, with automatic weather stations, which collect comprehensive hydrometeorological data, allows for a robust dataset that captures the complex interactions between energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. This combination enhances the accuracy and reliability of the data, offering a more comprehensive understanding of the oasis-desert ecosystem dynamics and their role in the global carbon cycle.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统的集成提供了关于湍流通量的高分辨率数据，而自动气象站则收集全面的水文气象数据，这种结合形成了一个强大的数据集，捕捉了能量、水汽和碳交换之间的复杂相互作用。这种组合提高了数据的准确性和可靠性，为更全面理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统动态及其在全球碳循环中的作用提供了支持。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors influence the selection of data collection methods for observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据收集方法选择的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The selection of data collection methods is influenced by the need to quantitatively understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting ecological stability and socioeconomic development. Long-term observations are necessary to support these goals.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法的选择受到定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的需求的影响，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及保护生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。长期观察对于支持这些目标是必要的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why are oases significant in the context of arid and semiarid region studies, and how does this impact data collection strategies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 绿洲在干旱和半干旱地区研究中具有重要意义，这影响了数据收集策略。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Oases are significant because they support more than 90% of the population in arid regions despite comprising less than 10% of the total area. This unique ecological and socioeconomic role necessitates a focus on maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems, impacting data collection strategies to ensure sustainable development and ecological security.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 绿洲之所以重要，是因为它们支持了干旱地区超过90%的人口，尽管它们的总面积不到10%。这种独特的生态和社会经济角色需要关注维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，这影响了数据收集策略，以确保可持续发展和生态安全。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What challenges drive the development of comprehensive observational datasets for oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 推动综合观测数据集开发的挑战是什么，针对绿洲-沙漠系统？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges such as ecological environment degradation, including the drying up of rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, land desertification intensification, and frequent dust storms drive the need for comprehensive observational datasets. These challenges are particularly critical in regions like the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 生态环境恶化的挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，驱动了对综合观测数据集的需求。这些挑战在塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域等地区尤为严重。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating phenological camera data with traditional hydrometeorological observations in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将表型相机数据与传统水文气象观测相结合在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating phenological camera data with traditional hydrometeorological observations may enhance the understanding of vegetation dynamics and their interactions with energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis-desert ecosystems, potentially leading to improved predictions of ecological stability and carbon cycle impacts.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将物候相机数据与传统水文气象观测相结合，可能增强对植被动态及其与绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换过程相互作用的理解，从而有助于改善生态稳定性和碳循环影响的预测。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for long-term data collection in arid and semiarid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行长期数据收集的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers for long-term data collection may provide detailed insights into energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in arid and semiarid regions, enabling a better understanding of oasis-desert interactions and contributing to strategies for sustainable development and carbon neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪进行长期数据收集，可以深入了解干旱和半干旱地区的能量、水蒸气和碳通量，从而更好地理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用，并为可持续发展和碳中和目标的策略贡献力量。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the effects of employing automatic weather stations with short average periods on the quality and resolution of climate data in inland river basins?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在内陆河流流域使用短平均周期的自动气象站可能对气候数据的质量和分辨率产生什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Employing automatic weather stations with short average periods could lead to high-resolution climate data, which may improve the accuracy of hydrometeorological analyses and support comprehensive assessments of ecological environment changes and challenges in inland river basins.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用短平均周期的自动气象站可以获得高分辨率的气候数据，这可能提高水文气象分析的准确性，并支持对内陆河流域生态环境变化和挑战的全面评估。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中维持对能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期观测是必要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are indispensable to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. This understanding is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases, as well as to support the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用具有重要意义，并对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展，以及支持碳达峰和碳中和的目标具有重要作用。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What motivates the integration of phenological camera observations with data transmission capabilities in mixed forest stations?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 是什么驱动了在混合森林站中将物候相机观察与数据传输能力相结合？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The integration of phenological camera observations with data transmission capabilities is motivated by the need to collect time-series data on vegetation dynamics, specifically the relative greenness index (GCC). This data is essential for calculating key phenological parameters, such as the start and end of the growing season, which are crucial for understanding vegetation responses and ecosystem processes.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 将表型相机观察与数据传输能力相结合的动机在于需要收集关于植被动态的时间序列数据，特别是相对绿度指数（GCC）。这些数据对于计算关键的表型参数（如生长季节的开始和结束）至关重要，这对于理解植被响应和生态系统过程非常重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it critical to achieve a balance between oasis and desert systems in the context of sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在可持续发展的背景下，实现绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡至关重要。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Achieving a balance between oasis and desert systems is critical to maintain the ecological stability and support the sustainable development of oases. Oases are vital for the ecological environment and economic foundation in arid and semi-arid regions, and their stability is essential for the ecological security and socioeconomic development of these areas, particularly in the context of global climate change.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 在绿洲和沙漠系统之间实现平衡对于维持生态稳定性和支持绿洲的可持续发展至关重要。绿洲在干旱和半干旱地区的生态环境和经济基础中具有重要作用，其稳定性对于这些地区的生态安全和社会经济发展至关重要，特别是在全球气候变化的背景下。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in using phenological cameras to collect and process data for determining key phenophase parameters in mixed forests?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
使用表型相机收集和处理数据以确定混合森林中关键表型阶段参数的步骤包括：

1. 选择合适的地点：选择具有代表性的混合森林区域，确保能够捕捉到不同植物物种的表型阶段变化。

2. 安装表型相机：在选定地点安装表型相机，确保相机能够覆盖所需的观察区域，并设置适当的拍摄角度和高度。

3. 设置拍摄频率：根据研究需求设置相机的拍摄频率，通常为每天或每周拍摄一次，以捕捉植物生长和变化的动态。

4. 数据收集：定期收集相机拍摄的图像数据，确保数据的完整性和连续性。

5. 数据处理：使用图像处理软件对收集到的图像进行分析，识别和标记不同植物的表型阶段。

6. 记录关键参数：根据图像分析结果，记录关键的表型阶段参数，如开花、结果、叶片展开等。

7. 数据分析：对记录的表型阶段参数进行统计分析，识别不同物种之间的表型变化模式和时间。

8. 结果验证：通过实地观察和其他数据来源验证分析结果的准确性。

9. 报告和发布：整理研究结果，撰写报告或论文，并在相关领域的会议或期刊上发布。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The process involves using a phenological camera positioned vertically downward to collect images with a resolution of 1280x720. The data is collected at specified time intervals. For calculating the greenness index, the relative greenness index (GCC) is determined using the formula GCC=G/(R+G+B), where R, G, and B are the red, green, and blue pixel values of the image. The data then undergoes invalid value filling and smoothing filtration. Finally, key phenophase parameters such as the start, peak, and end of the growing season are determined by fitting to the growth curve.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 该过程涉及使用垂直向下定位的物候相机收集分辨率为1280x720的图像。数据按照指定的时间间隔进行收集。为了计算绿色指数，相对绿色指数（GCC）使用公式GCC=G/(R+G+B)来确定，其中R、G和B分别是图像的红色、绿色和蓝色像素值。数据随后经过无效值填充和光滑滤波处理。最后，通过拟合生长曲线确定关键的物候阶段参数，如生长季节的开始、峰值和结束。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is the vegetation cover calculated from images captured by phenological cameras, and what preprocessing steps are necessary?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何从表型相机捕获的图像中计算植被覆盖率，以及需要哪些预处理步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To calculate vegetation cover, images are preprocessed by selecting those with moderate lighting conditions. The images are segmented into vegetation and soil sections, and the proportion of vegetation pixels within the area of interest is calculated as the cover for each image. After extracting the time series data, the original cover data is smoothed using a filtering process according to a user-specified time window, resulting in the final time series of cover data.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了计算植被覆盖，图像经过预处理，选择光照条件适中的图像。图像被分割为植被和土壤部分，并计算感兴趣区域内植被像素的比例作为每幅图像的覆盖率。在提取时间序列数据后，原始覆盖数据根据用户指定的时间窗口进行平滑处理，从而得到最终的覆盖数据时间序列。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are employed to ensure the quality control and processing of hydrometeorological and flux data collected from oasis-desert ecosystems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 确保从绿洲-沙漠生态系统收集的水文气象和通量数据的质量控制和处理所采用的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality control and processing involve collecting hydrometeorological data (such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles) using automatic weather stations with a 10-minute average period. This includes data on gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles. Additionally, turbulent flux data is acquired using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The data collection process is followed by data processing, archiving, and sharing, ensuring comprehensive quality control.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量控制和处理涉及使用自动气象站收集水文气象数据（如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面），数据采集周期为10分钟平均值。这包括空气温度和湿度的梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水量以及土壤湿度剖面的数据。此外，使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取湍流通量数据。数据收集过程之后进行数据处理、归档和共享，确保全面的质量控制。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational technologies are essential for collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些观测技术对于在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集关于能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据是必不可少的？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Observational technologies such as eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations are essential for collecting comprehensive data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange. These technologies provide half-hourly turbulent flux data and hydrometeorological data, including radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 观测技术如涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站对于收集能量、水蒸气和碳交换的综合数据至关重要。这些技术提供半小时的湍流通量数据和水文气象数据，包括辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水和土壤湿度剖面。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do data processing and quality control procedures enable the effective use of datasets from long-term environmental observations?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序如何使长期环境观测数据集的有效使用成为可能。
Enablement.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control procedures enable the effective use of datasets from long-term environmental observations by dividing the process into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. This ensures that the data is accurate, reliable, and accessible for further analysis and research.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序通过将过程分为数据收集、数据处理以及数据归档和共享，使长期环境观测数据集的有效使用成为可能。这确保了数据的准确性、可靠性和可供进一步分析和研究的可访问性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observational datasets be crucial for understanding the interactions in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的相互作用可能至关重要，原因如下：
Expectation.AnswerEn: A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges are anticipated in collecting reliable data from inland river basins in arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，从内陆河流流域收集可靠数据时预计会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境恶化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might it be necessary to use a combination of observational datasets and auxiliary data for effective study of oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在有效研究绿洲-沙漠系统时，可能有必要使用观测数据集和辅助数据的组合？
Expectation.AnswerEn: A suite of observational datasets from oasis–desert systems that include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, are necessary to provide a comprehensive understanding of these ecosystems.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 一套来自绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，对于全面理解这些生态系统是必要的。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How would you evaluate the effectiveness of the data collection methods used in acquiring energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在获取绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳通量时使用的数据收集方法的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involving eddy covariance systems and scintillometers, complemented by automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data, provide a comprehensive suite of long-term observational datasets. This combination of methods seems effective in capturing detailed energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, crucial for understanding oasis–desert interactions and supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 涉及涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪的数据收集方法，辅以自动气象站获取水文气象数据，提供了一套全面的长期观测数据集。这种方法组合在捕捉详细的能量、水蒸气和碳通量方面似乎非常有效，对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及支持生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What challenges do you foresee in maintaining and expanding datasets for long-term observations in arid and semiarid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 我预见在维持和扩展干旱及半干旱地区的长期观测数据集时会面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining and expanding datasets in these regions could include environmental degradation such as river and lake drying, vegetation loss, desertification, and dust storms. These factors, coupled with logistical difficulties in harsh climates and remote locations, could pose significant obstacles to consistent data collection and dataset expansion.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在这些地区，维护和扩展数据集的挑战可能包括环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、植被损失、沙漠化和沙尘暴。这些因素，加上在恶劣气候和偏远地区的后勤困难，可能对持续的数据收集和数据集扩展构成重大障碍。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how data from phenology cameras can be effectively processed to determine key phenological parameters in ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白如何有效处理来自物候相机的数据以确定生态系统中的关键物候参数。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data from phenology cameras is processed by calculating the relative greenness index (GCC) using the formula GCC=G/(R+G+B), where R, G, and B are the pixel values of the red, green, and blue channels of an image. This data undergoes invalid value filling and filtering to smooth the growth curves, which are then used to determine key phenological parameters such as the start, peak, and end of the growing season.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 来自物候相机的数据通过计算相对绿色指数（GCC）来处理，公式为GCC=G/(R+G+B)，其中R、G和B分别是图像中红色、绿色和蓝色通道的像素值。该数据经过无效值填充和过滤，以平滑生长曲线，然后用于确定关键的物候参数，如生长季节的开始、峰值和结束。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in maintaining data quality and consistency when observing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在观察绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换时，维护数据质量和一致性所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality include dealing with ecological environment degradation, like drying rivers and lakes, natural vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms in inland river basins. These factors can affect the accuracy and consistency of data collected over long periods, making quality control procedures like data processing and archiving crucial.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量的挑战包括应对生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化以及内陆河流域的沙尘暴。这些因素可能影响长期收集的数据的准确性和一致性，因此数据处理和归档等质量控制程序显得尤为重要。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how datasets can be expanded or refined to improve the understanding of oasis–desert interactions and support sustainable development.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解如何扩展或细化数据集以改善对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的理解，并支持可持续发展。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Datasets can be expanded or refined by incorporating long-term observations that include energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as supplementary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters. This comprehensive approach allows for a more quantitative understanding of the interactions in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is vital for achieving ecological security and sustainable development.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据集可以通过纳入长期观测数据来扩展或精炼，这些观测数据包括能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的补充数据。这种综合方法使我们能够更定量地理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的相互作用，这对于实现生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the role of phenological camera data in determining key phenological parameters and how these parameters can be used to enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析表型相机数据在确定关键表型参数中的作用，以及这些参数如何用于增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Phenological camera data, which includes the relative greenness index (GCC), is crucial for determining key phenological parameters such as the start, peak, and end of the growing season. These parameters provide insights into vegetation dynamics, which are essential for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This approach involves capturing data with cameras, calculating the GCC, and using growth curve fitting to determine phenological phases. This understanding aids in achieving carbon neutrality and supporting ecological security and sustainable development in oases.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 表型相机数据，包括相对绿度指数（GCC），对于确定生长季节的开始、峰值和结束等关键表型参数至关重要。这些参数提供了对植被动态的洞察，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。这种方法涉及使用相机捕获数据，计算GCC，并使用生长曲线拟合来确定表型阶段。这种理解有助于实现碳中和，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore the challenges encountered during the data collection process in arid and semiarid inland river basins and suggest methods to overcome these challenges.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域的数据收集过程中遇到的挑战，并建议克服这些挑战的方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges in data collection in arid and semiarid inland river basins include ecological degradation like the drying of rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and dust storms. Overcoming these challenges involves establishing long-term observational networks, such as eddy covariance systems and meteorological stations, to consistently monitor energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes. Implementing quality control procedures and supplementing data with hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters can enhance data reliability and support sustainable development goals in these regions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域，数据收集面临的挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化和沙尘暴。克服这些挑战的方法包括建立长期观测网络，如涡度协方差系统和气象站，以持续监测能量、水蒸气和碳通量。实施质量控制程序，并补充水文气象、植被和土壤参数的数据，可以提高数据的可靠性，并支持这些地区的可持续发展目标。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please conduct an analysis of the data processing and quality control techniques employed in collecting and sharing datasets of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请对在收集和共享绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换数据集时采用的数据处理和质量控制技术进行分析。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Data processing and quality control techniques in collecting datasets of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange involve systematic data collection, processing, and archiving. The data collected from eddy covariance systems and meteorological stations undergo quality checks to ensure accuracy. The datasets, which include fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters, are then archived and shared for broader accessibility, as exemplified by availability through the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center. This rigorous process is essential for understanding oasis–desert interactions and ensuring data usability for ecological and socio-economic research.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制技术在收集能量、水汽和碳交换的数据集时涉及系统的数据收集、处理和归档。从涡度协方差系统和气象站收集的数据经过质量检查，以确保准确性。这些数据集包括通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数，然后被归档并共享，以便更广泛的可获取性，例如通过国家西藏高原数据中心提供。这一严格的过程对于理解绿洲-沙漠相互作用至关重要，并确保数据在生态和社会经济研究中的可用性。
